trans-unit.source: You can use a RichEditBox control to enter and edit rich text documents that contain formatted text, hyperlinks, and images.
trans-unit.target: You can use a RichEditBox control to enter and edit rich text documents that contain formatted text, hyperlinks, and images.

trans-unit.source: You can make a RichEditBox read-only by setting its IsReadOnly property to true.
trans-unit.target: You can make a RichEditBox read-only by setting its IsReadOnly property to true.

trans-unit.source: RichEditBox
trans-unit.target: RichEditBox

trans-unit.source: Rich edit box
trans-unit.target: Rich edit box

trans-unit.source: You can use a RichEditBox control to enter and edit rich text documents that contain formatted text, hyperlinks, and images.
trans-unit.target: You can use a RichEditBox control to enter and edit rich text documents that contain formatted text, hyperlinks, and images.

trans-unit.source: You can make a RichEditBox read-only by setting its IsReadOnly property to **true**.
trans-unit.target: You can make a RichEditBox read-only by setting its IsReadOnly property to **true**.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: RichEditBox class
trans-unit.target: RichEditBox class

trans-unit.source: Document property
trans-unit.target: Document property

trans-unit.source: IsReadOnly property
trans-unit.target: IsReadOnly property

trans-unit.source: IsSpellCheckEnabled property
trans-unit.target: IsSpellCheckEnabled property

trans-unit.source: Is this the right control?
trans-unit.target: Is this the right control?

trans-unit.source: Use a **RichEditBox** to display and edit text files.
trans-unit.target: Use a **RichEditBox** to display and edit text files.

trans-unit.source: You don't use a RichEditBox to get user input into you app the way you use other standard text input boxes.
trans-unit.target: You don't use a RichEditBox to get user input into you app the way you use other standard text input boxes.

trans-unit.source: Rather, you use it to work with text files that are separate from your app.
trans-unit.target: Rather, you use it to work with text files that are separate from your app.

trans-unit.source: You typically save text entered into a RichEditBox to a .rtf file.
trans-unit.target: You typically save text entered into a RichEditBox to a .rtf file.

trans-unit.source: If the primary purpose of the multi-line text box is for creating documents (such as blog entries or the contents of an email message), and those documents require rich text, use a rich text box.
trans-unit.target: If the primary purpose of the multi-line text box is for creating documents (such as blog entries or the contents of an email message), and those documents require rich text, use a rich text box.

trans-unit.source: If you want users to be able to format their text, use a rich text box.
trans-unit.target: If you want users to be able to format their text, use a rich text box.

trans-unit.source: When capturing text that will only be consumed and not redisplayed to users, use a plain text input control.
trans-unit.target: When capturing text that will only be consumed and not redisplayed to users, use a plain text input control.

trans-unit.source: For all other scenarios, use a plain text input control.
trans-unit.target: For all other scenarios, use a plain text input control.

trans-unit.source: For more info about choosing the right text control, see the [Text controls](text-controls.md) article.
trans-unit.target: For more info about choosing the right text control, see the [Text controls](text-controls.md) article.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: This rich edit box has a rich text document open in it.
trans-unit.target: This rich edit box has a rich text document open in it.

trans-unit.source: The formatting and file buttons aren't part of the rich edit box, but you should provide at least a minimal set of styling buttons and implement their actions.
trans-unit.target: The formatting and file buttons aren't part of the rich edit box, but you should provide at least a minimal set of styling buttons and implement their actions.

trans-unit.source: A rich text box with an open document
trans-unit.target: A rich text box with an open document

trans-unit.source: Create a rich edit box
trans-unit.target: Create a rich edit box

trans-unit.source: By default, the RichEditBox supports spell checking.
trans-unit.target: By default, the RichEditBox supports spell checking.

trans-unit.source: To disable the spell checker, set the [IsSpellCheckEnabled](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richeditbox.isspellcheckenabled.aspx) property to **false**.
trans-unit.target: To disable the spell checker, set the [IsSpellCheckEnabled](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richeditbox.isspellcheckenabled.aspx) property to **false**.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see Guidelines and checklist for spell checking.
trans-unit.target: For more info, see Guidelines and checklist for spell checking.

trans-unit.source: You use the [Document](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richeditbox.document.aspx) property of the RichEditBox to get its content.
trans-unit.target: You use the [Document](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richeditbox.document.aspx) property of the RichEditBox to get its content.

trans-unit.source: The content of a RichEditBox is a [Windows.UI.Text.ITextDocument](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/bb774052.aspx) object, unlike the RichTextBlock control, which uses [Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Block](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.block.aspx) objects as its content.
trans-unit.target: The content of a RichEditBox is a [Windows.UI.Text.ITextDocument](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/bb774052.aspx) object, unlike the RichTextBlock control, which uses [Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Block](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.block.aspx) objects as its content.

trans-unit.source: The ITextDocument interface provides a way to load and save the document to a stream, retrieve text ranges, get the active selection, undo and redo changes, set default formatting attributes, and so on.
trans-unit.target: The ITextDocument interface provides a way to load and save the document to a stream, retrieve text ranges, get the active selection, undo and redo changes, set default formatting attributes, and so on.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to edit, load, and save a Rich Text Format (.rtf) file in a RichEditBox.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to edit, load, and save a Rich Text Format (.rtf) file in a RichEditBox.

trans-unit.source: Choose the right keyboard for your text control
trans-unit.target: Choose the right keyboard for your text control

trans-unit.source: To help users to enter data using the touch keyboard, or Soft Input Panel (SIP), you can set the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data the user is expected to enter.
trans-unit.target: To help users to enter data using the touch keyboard, or Soft Input Panel (SIP), you can set the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data the user is expected to enter.

trans-unit.source: The default keyboard layout is usually appropriate for working with rich text documents.
trans-unit.target: The default keyboard layout is usually appropriate for working with rich text documents.

trans-unit.source: For more info about how to use input scopes, see [Use input scope to change the touch keyboard]().
trans-unit.target: For more info about how to use input scopes, see [Use input scope to change the touch keyboard]().

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: When you create a rich text box, provide styling buttons and implement their actions.
trans-unit.target: When you create a rich text box, provide styling buttons and implement their actions.

trans-unit.source: Use a font that's consistent with the style of your app.
trans-unit.target: Use a font that's consistent with the style of your app.

trans-unit.source: Make the height of the text control tall enough to accommodate typical entries.
trans-unit.target: Make the height of the text control tall enough to accommodate typical entries.

trans-unit.source: Don't let your text input controls grow in height while users type.
trans-unit.target: Don't let your text input controls grow in height while users type.

trans-unit.source: Don't use a multi-line text box when users only need a single line.
trans-unit.target: Don't use a multi-line text box when users only need a single line.

trans-unit.source: Don't use a rich text control if a plain text control is adequate.
trans-unit.target: Don't use a rich text control if a plain text control is adequate.

trans-unit.source: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the [Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=258743).\]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the [Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=258743).\]
